title: What are the different types of computer users? - Quora

response.answer_text: Gamer: Plays games for hours on end. Probably runs a 1060 and i5 with 8gb of ram. Budget gamer: Plays games on a laptop. Often has FPS issues. Grandparent: Uses Internet explorer with 75% of their window covered in toolbars. Master racer: Has at least three monitors. RGB LEDs everywhere. Mechanical keyboard required. Computer must have an i7 and two 1080s. Steam account is probably worth thousands. Has at least 32 GB DDR4 RAM. Water cooled computer. Appler: Has an iMac, Mac Book, iPad, and an iPhone. Buys the new ones every year. The Sudo: Suggests switching to Linux every time you talk about a problem your computer had. Programmer: Coffee in. Code out. Windows Phone user: A rare creature. Highly endagered, and likely soon to be extinct. Beige mage: Has like 30 retro computers and nearly every retro game ever made. Gaming YouTuber/Twitch streamer: Probably has a loud obnoxious intro. “Gaming” at the end of their channel name. Probably uses a DXracer gaming chair. It was just a prank bro (Social experiment YouTuber): Really loud and obnoxious. Knows a lot of local actors. Says dude and bro every five seconds.

Casual User/Beginner: Young gamer, Grandpa, Grandma, Mother, Daddy, the new immigrants from a developing country. Budget system, dated components, may have no graphics card installed inside. Gamer/Work user: Uses the computer everyday but does not know how the computer really works or how it’s put together. Has a solid system with medium end components and single monitor. Low to medium end graphics card inside the PC case. Hardcore power user/modders/PC master race: Heavy PC user that builds his own high end muscle systems. This guy is into CADD or 3D modelling, hard core MMO gaming and spends a great deal of extra money continuously upgrading his system to all top end components. This guy is also very familiar with finer points of tweeking, overclocking and using a lot of mods on his PCs for special effects, bonus performance and extra immersion in gaming. You know there is a power user in the house when the guy has a custom water cooled PC with an oversized power supply, two graphics cards and a trio of high quality monitors. This guy often loves to display his high end PC hardware under case lighting you can view through a case window.
